lines.content: TimL is a chatbot that functions as a task manager to help you store any task on a list.
It is also optimized for use via Command Line Interface (CLI).
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed on your computer.
3. Copy the file to a folder you want as the home directory of the file.
4. From the command terminal, cd into the home directory of the jar file and run the command `java -jar TimL.jar` to launch the application.
5. Type a command in the command box and press Enter to execute it. Refer to Features below for details of each available command.
>Words between dash - are parameters to be input by the user
e.g. in todo -TASK- where TASK is the parameter to be input by the user used as todo finish assignment
>All tasks are displayed in the format INDEX_NUMBER.[TASK_TYPE][MARKED_STATUS] TASK_DESCRIPTION e.g.
Event: 7: [E][ ] california road trip (from: 2 feb to: 26 feb)
**You can add 3 different types of tasks to the list using these 3 different commands.**
* Adds a Todo task to the task list
* Adds a Deadline task to the task list
* Adds an Event task to the task list
* **Format**: `event -the task to be done- /from -the start date- /to -the end date-`
### - Setting a task's status to be done:
>- INDEX must be a positive integer less than or equals to the current number of tasks in the task list
>- If task selected is already marked, it will remain marked
### - Setting a task's status to be incomplete:
>- INDEX must be a positive integer less than or equals to the current number of tasks in the task list
>- If task selected is already marked, it will remain marked
- Deletes a task from the task list
INDEX must be a positive integer less than or equals to the current number of tasks in the task list
- Finds all task containing an identical keyword from the task list
Roger that! i've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Roger that! i've added this task:
Now you have 2 task in the list.
Roger that! i've added this task:
Now you have 3 task in the list.
HERE ARE YOUR MATCHING TASKS IN YOUR LIST:
Nice!! I've marked this task as done:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!

* Deadline subclass that inherits from Task
* Event subclass that inherits from Task

public static void addDeadline(String message) throws EmptyException {

* Todo subclass that inherits from Task

* @param response text that the user has input into the TimL
* This class provides functionalities for managing files related to task data, including exporting data to a file and
* Check for the existence of a data file, reads its contents and adds tasks through the task manager
* @param taskManager is an instance of TaskManager to which tasks will be added after reading from the file
* Exports data from the task manager to a file located at the specified data path
* @throws IOException if an I/O error happens during file creation of writing
public static void exportData() throws IOException {
* This class provides functionalities for parsing data to and from file representations.
* Reads a string of data and process it into a new task
* @param taskData a line of data to be processed
* @return task a new task that is to be added to the Array List
* @throws TimException if the task description is empty
public static Task readTask(String taskData) throws TimException {
* @param data string that is to be split
* Convert information of a Todo task to text file format
* @param taskInfo information of Todo task that will be split
* @return a Todo task in text file format
return TODO_SYMBOL + SEPARATOR + doneSymbol + SEPARATOR + taskName;
* Convert information of a Deadline task to text file format
* @param taskInfo information of deadline that will be split
* @return a deadline in text file format
return DEADLINE_SYMBOL + SEPARATOR + doneSymbol + SEPARATOR + taskName + SEPARATOR + deadlineTime;
* Convert information of an Event task to text file format
* @param taskInfo information of event that will be split
* @return an event in text file format
return EVENT_SYMBOL + SEPARATOR + doneSymbol + SEPARATOR + taskName + SEPARATOR + eventStart + SEPARATOR + eventEnd;

* Returns the command word from the input

* Extracts the task name from a given message by locating the substring preceding a specified indicator.
* @param message the message from which th task name will be extracted
* @return string representing the extracted task name
* Extracts event durations from a given message by locating substrings between specified start and end indicators.
* @param message represents message from which the durations are extracted
* @return a String array. First element represents start duration, second element represents end duration
